website_summaries.verdict: A well-made litter scoop that's sturdy and can tackle heavy-duty cleanup. With the exception of a few quirks, it's a close contender for the best.
pros: Made of aluminum with a contoured handle that's designed for optimal leverage
Sturdy construction can tackle tough jobs, including those that require scraping
Soft-grip coating adds comfort when you scoop
cons: Waste occasionally sticks to the surface, and some small pieces tend to fall through the slots

customer_reviews.title: Not happy!!
customer_reviews.text: I am actually pretty upset and disgusted, not only was this not the same color but it was clearly a used return... 😝 If you can see in the pics I posted there’s black smudges and specks on it which I thought was just dust or whatever. After closer inspection though, I’m 99% positive it’s actually old litter remnants from being used. Just gross!!
customer_reviews.author: StlRealtor

customer_reviews.title: BIOHAZARD! MINE WAS CLEARLY USED!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT ARRIVED TO ME CLEARLY USED & POORLY CLEANED! I work at an animal shelter, so I know a poorly cleaned scoop when I see one. As someone VERY familiar with the kinds of cat diseases that can be spread through urine & feces, I am ABSOLUTELY appalled. Sending it back. Be warned, this could be INSANELY UNSAFE for your feline friend if they make a habit of “cleaning” returns & sending them back out.
customer_reviews.author: Angelina

customer_reviews.title: Dirty/used
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if by “tested” they actually test it before sending it. Mine came in open generic plastic bag, with visible dirt and grime. The teal handle was dirty as well, with dirt already rubbed into the handle. Not thrilled to buy a scoop that’s dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Arrived dirty
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a dirty handle and the scoop portion had debris stuck to it.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Product picture was not accurate
customer_reviews.text: The scoop that arrived was nothing like the one pictured. I’m mainly disappointed because the handle in the picture looks like it has a comfortable no-slip grip on it and the one I received is just flat and metal. I didn’t return it because it was an additional hassle plus cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have a second one now that I use in the garden....
customer_reviews.text: I bought and lost the first one in the garage somewhere so I bought another one as a replacement. I found the first one the same day as the new one arrived, which is typical for me. I could have returned it (not likely) or just left it in the garage to be used one day but upon studying it, I thought it would work well as a sturdy dirt/potting soil scoop and it for sure was!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Bailey

customer_reviews.title: No idea why this is a best seller
customer_reviews.text: It's metal and it's strong. Those are the only selling points. If you're scoping nothing smaller than an intact ping pong ball, this is great, otherwise, completely useless. It leaves all of the small broken bits in the litter box. I cleaned it and donated to the local animal rescue group.
customer_reviews.author: Wiremom

customer_reviews.title: Smaller fecal matter slips through and ...
customer_reviews.text: I should not have ordered this but I rushed through the process. I receive my newspapers in plastic sleeves; after checking for holes and double-bagging them - recycling the plastic. I use them for my soiled litter. This scooper is too wide to fit into the newspaper bag making it awkward to insert the scooper that contains the soiled clumps of litter. The gaps are very slightly larger than my old grocery store one and a few unwanted particles have slipped through. It is heavy but that isn't the problem for me. It does feel nice holding it. My ratings of ergonomics and sturdiness are, therefore, irrelevant to me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Arsenault

customer_reviews.title: Metal litter scoop
customer_reviews.text: This metal scoop looks like it will be durable for the long run. Although it is ergonomic I find it very heavy. I do have arthritis in my hands so that could be a factor. My major complaint is that the thickness of the metal prevents me from scooping under the entire litter ball. I have to go back and scrape to get the remainder. I use a clumping litter. Perhaps if you use a wheat litter or some other product it would work better.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Avers

customer_reviews.title: Clean First
customer_reviews.text: It does the trick, and only time will reveal its longevity. I bought it because it's metal, so I shouldn't have to keep buying plastic ones. Only time will confirm that. I read a review when I bought it, that either the seller, or, Amazon was cleaning and reselling returned scoops. I didn't let it deter me from trying it, however, I'm afraid I too have received a previously returned scooper. My suggestion is make sure you clean well before using just in case
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hands down, the best litter scoop available ANYWHERE
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing that makes sifting through heavy clumping litter easier than this scoop. Using the conventional plastic scoops is a complete waste of time, not to mention how short-lived the conventional scoops are under heavy use. The good side of the new clumping litters is that they work amazingly well. The bad side is that they are VERY dense and heavy to sift through. This scoop takes all of the effort out of a nasty job and cuts the time in half. It may seem like a lot to spend for a litter scoop, but I promise you this one will outlast the cheap plastic ones 1,000 to 1. Do the math.
customer_reviews.author: D. Goggans

customer_reviews.title: Metal is better than plastic!
customer_reviews.text: Yup, I've never spent more than $4 on a litter scoop before now. Better yet I've bought the litter boxes that come with a (cheap) plastic scoop. This scoop, however, is a game changer. Yup, it's pricey as scoops go. But hot damn, it's worth every penny! It has a sharp enough edge to scrape off those stubborn clumps on the side of the box. It won't bend under the weight of heavy clumps (I have three cats.) And it's very easy to hold/grip, with an ergonomic handle. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Good in theory
customer_reviews.text: Yes this scoop is amazingly strong but the metal edges dig in to the plastic bottom of the litter box making scooping the litter actually way more difficult that with a plastic scoop.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: A must if you use coarser, natural litter
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scoop, and an absolute MUST if you use coarser, natural litter (I use antibiotic-free layer hen chicken feed crumbles). I just bought one for my second litter box, because it's basically torture to try to use anything else. I tried the iPrimio litter scoop ( but the slats were just too small for the litter I use. I would definitely recommend the iPrimio if you use the fine clay litter. Mostly because it is slightly more narrow and has rounded corners, which makes it so much better at cleaning the corners of the box, which is the only place my cat will pee lol. I really wish the durascoop had rounded corners!! But otherwise it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah White

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I’m assuming you’ve got poop to scoop or you wouldn’t be here reading this right now. I’ve been using this scoop for a year now and hands down its the best litter scoop I’ve ever used. The slats are narrow enough to catch smaller litter remnants. The scoop is heavy-duty and the handle is cushioned and comfortable , so you won’t get blisters like you can from plastic litter scoopers. It’s held up a year now, so it’s durable. The metal part of the scoop base extends far into the handle, so the cushioned handle won’t bend and rip at the top like cheaper models can. This litter scooper means business.
customer_reviews.author: Acejvs

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I've used a plastic scooper for years, and finally decided it was time for an upgrade. I looked at several different scoopers and settled on this one. Pros: 1. It's nice and big, so it picks up more at one time. 2. The slots are just the right size so that the litter falls through and the clumps--even the smaller ones-- stay put. 3. Because it's stainless steel, very little adheres to the scooper, unlike a plastic one. 4. Because of the handle's configuration, it's very easy to hold. There aren't any negatives I can think of, and I'm very happy with this scooper. Therefore, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ComfyShoeMaven

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I have been on the fence about purchasing this scooper because I had a plastic one that I thought was ok. Now I feel silly for not having picked this up much sooner this scoop feels premium and helps pick up clumps way easier than my old plastic scoop. This scoop also is great because when I scoop the clumps don't break up there by needing more scooping.
customer_reviews.author: LEJTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Be ready for a random color scoop.
customer_reviews.text: Just received. While the functionality seems good, I was disappointed by the randomness of the colors that you could receive, the parenthesis state that colors vary- completely missed this at the time of order. The main page photo there is a teal colored one which was what I expected and when I opened my package it was pink. So basically they will send you any color which I didn’t like and doesn’t allowing a specific color selection.
customer_reviews.author: queenbeeisme2000

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but the angle/curve isn't right
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to using this due to how sturdy it seems and all the good reviews it got. It is definitely sturdy. However it doesn't work well for how we scoop our cat litter. We like to make sure the cats have a lot of litter and like to sift through all the way in the bottom to search for buried treasures. The curve on this makes it hard to go down to the bottom of the litter box since the curve causes it to naturally turn upwards as you push it down. We are going back to our litter lifter, which is better for our purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Poor College Student

customer_reviews.title: The Mother of all Scoopers
customer_reviews.text: Until l got this, l hadn't realized how inferior the metal one l had been using was. This is seriously the mother of all scoopers. Solid construction. Heavy "doody"..lol. The one l had cracked at the connection mid-scoop. That was pleasant. I definitely recommend this particular scoop. We have two cats and are obsessive about cleaning the box. That's why people who visit don't get "the look" when entering. You know the one...the cross between "what the hell is that smell?!" and then the contempt sneer, because you're not doing your box cleaning correctly. Cleaning with this scoop is easy and quick. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ChattyCat

customer_reviews.title: TL;dr - Scoops poop; does job.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good scoop. I’m usually a cheap arse when it comes to things to scoop poop, but I’m getting too old for this life and I just want to scoop it out fast and get away from it as quickly as possible. This scoop is sturdy, doesn’t slip out of your hand, doesn’t bend and can be cleaned without touching it with cleaning implements. I use a strong jet of hot water to clean off the sticky stuff that sometimes gets on there if you scoop too soon. I bought a scoop holder cup thing that another person recommended and that works great for holding it. Now, everything for poop scooping is tidy and efficient. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Walling

customer_reviews.title: Solves a problem you may not have
customer_reviews.text: After busting my second plastic litter scoop in two weeks, I sought out to buy metal. This is very sturdy, through the silicone grip moves around a little too much to be ignorable, but is no big deal. You may not need this, though, if the problem is scooping litter off the bottom of the litter box. Changing out the litter, adding more, and/or scooping the litter may be all you need. I stopped using this scoop when I started using a Litter Genie, as this is a very wide scoop which can be difficult deposit the waste into the opening of the litter genie. It can be difficult to scoop this into smaller bags, by the same concept.
customer_reviews.author: Quinton Baker

customer_reviews.title: The Best Design Available!
customer_reviews.text: I've used the DuraScoop for many years. And, yes, I tried other brands. But there really isn't any better. I believe it was the first all-metal solid construction, and I keep coming back to it. The only design weakness is in the very end of the handle, where there a rubber extension to hang the scoop; this is flexible, of course, and through time, it does break off, leaving a rough end which is irritating in the palm as one scoops the lumps of litter. But as I said, you really can't get a better scoop. The others that I've tried have much worse flaws. So DuraScoop, I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AdoptAPet

customer_reviews.title: Rise up against the shackles of clay litter
customer_reviews.text: I grew tired of paying Arm & Hammer's price for clay litter, disliked the dust and possible damage said dust was doing to the animal's lungs so I made the move to pine pellets. Extruded pine comes in a more or less uniform diameter from brand to brand and this scoop has holes in it that just allow the solid ones to stay put and the sawdust created from liquid to fall through. My pica ridden cat chewed off the rubber handle but it still holds strong after 7 years of steady use. This latest purchase was for my mother who is taking care of the other cat who my cat no longer tolerates.
customer_reviews.author: GoodEgg

customer_reviews.title: The PERFECT Kitty Litter Scoop!
customer_reviews.text: This is the sturdiest and best cat litter scoop I have ever used. I bought another DuraScoop Jumbo Cat Litter Scoop after the color handle wrap wore away from the one I bought many years ago. I had kept my scoop outside, so daily wear and tear and the outside elements took their toll on the sponge grip. I did not know that the color grip portion was replaceable, so DuraScoop contacted me to let me know I did not have to replace the whole scoop. They sent me a few replacement handles and now I'm set!!! GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE from DuraScoop. Highly recommend, as this litter scoop will last many years!
customer_reviews.author: wendytime

customer_reviews.title: A great scoop for heavy clumping litter.
customer_reviews.text: This kitty litter scoop is definitely larger and more sturdy than the usual plastic kitty litter scoop, so I am quite pleased by it in that respect. The only thing I was disappointed by was that the slots are not quite narrow enough to catch the smallest clumps of used litter. That is a problem with the plastic ones as well, but I was hoping for better because of some of the reviews. In the short time I have had it I have not noticed any rust spots or corrosion on the metal. The handle is comfortable to hold and only has a weird flexible part on the very end that does not affect its usefulness.
customer_reviews.author: suzbuz1st

customer_reviews.title: does the job!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. Scooping cat litter is a nasty chore, and when my cheap plastic scoop broke, it got really disgusting using the handle-less scoop. So I bought this scoop and I so glad I did. First, it's metal so it won't snap in two - big plus. Then, it's about twice the size of my plastic scoop so it retrieves more 'product' in each pass. Third, the holes and slots in the scoop are wide so it collects solids much faster while rejecting more of the unclumped litter so scooping is less wasteful. Overall, I'm very happy with this scoop and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: BBinNOLA

customer_reviews.title: The Best Ever Tool for the Job
customer_reviews.text: This scooper is everything it claims to be, with solid metal running through the entire length and a soft grip handle. This immediately replaced the flimsy plastic scoop I had been using, which had ridges on the handle that cut into my hand. This is really quite a large scoop, but using the non-lightweight litter and keeping it 3 to 4 inches deep takes a lot of scooping, and this tool is quite up to the task. Your only limitation will be your personal arm strength. With four litter boxes that get cleaned every day, I have added this to my daily workout. This scoop is built to last, and I cannot imagine ever having to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Morris

customer_reviews.title: They aren't kidding when they say JUMBO
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I was always afraid that the plastic scoop that I had would break while using it. This scoop is very sturdy and also very BIG. I will never need to worry about it breaking in mid scoop. Because it is made of metal and doesn't have all of the ridges that my old scoop had it is so much easier to clean. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Blooblzr

customer_reviews.title: Definitely buy This one..........
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t sure if I already submitted a review so maybe doing it again.....as one reviewer commented, it’s like a “shovel “, and she is right....this scooper is a must-have if you have a cat liter to clean out.....it is soooo sturdy and well made.....I actually bought it for my daughter who has THREE cats.....and I ‘m house watching right now so I’ve been going over there daily to do the deed......it does pick up small pieces as one reviewer commented it didn’t.........I’m able to go deep to the bottom of the liter box and no bending like a plastic one would do.....I can’t Rave enough about this product.......definitely buy it!
customer_reviews.author: springchiknot

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price, and does the job good.
customer_reviews.text: My cat is about 15 pounds. He is one years old. And regular scoopers just don’t cut it. I buy special litter to make sure my cat does not get sick, and majority of the time since it is clumping you would break the regular old plastic scoopers. If you’re looking for a scooper that will work, this is the one for you. However do not expect to scoop the litter while it’s still wet and not think it’s going to be stuck on the scooper. I some review or stated it is stuck, we are mines does not due to the fact that I wait before I try to scoop it.
customer_reviews.author: lilFetty

customer_reviews.title: The last scoop I will have to buy.
customer_reviews.text: As I'm sure most of you know, litter scoops are flimsy and plastic, and break constantly. Not this one! This is all metal, even under the sleeve on the handle. It picks up even little pieces in the box and the wet litter does not stick to the scoop. I have an extra-large box and I can clean it all with 2-3 passes with this scoop. The weight does require some getting used to. It is much heavier than the plastic scoops and I had to get used to using it but it was worth it. Definitely worth it. I have 2 boxes and so purchased 2 scoops. I've been using this for 6+ months.
customer_reviews.author: Julie M.

customer_reviews.title: Best pooper scooper ever!
customer_reviews.text: Three cats, so lots of scooping! Kept breaking off the handles on plastic scoops. I decided to go with a metal one. I did not expect this scoop to be so durable. It is made of thick metal, and ergonomic. Love the nonslip handle, and the bumps underneath to fit between the fingers. The size is perfect...about the size of any jumbo version scooper. All the slots are a perfect size for scooping clumps and tootsie rolls...litter sifts through, clumps and tootsie rolls remain. I like that it is slightly heavier than the plastic ones, for easier digging, but still very light. Never thought I would be excited about a pooper scooper...but here I am!
customer_reviews.author: Kalin Ayhan

customer_reviews.title: Feels good, almost unbreakable
customer_reviews.text: After breaking 2 scoops this year I decided to give Amazon a try, and was not disappointed with this thing. It's completely solid all the way through the handle (except the last inch, which is hollow & flexible, but who cares). I'm a big guy, and this thing is so beefy I'm not sure I could break it even if I made a concerted effort to do so. The price couldn't be better, I'm actually surprised how solid it is at that price, I'd expect it to be more. Only downside is I doubt I'll ever have a reason to give this company any future business, this thing will probably last forever.
customer_reviews.author: jovialwoodchuck

customer_reviews.title: So efficient!
customer_reviews.text: I had never, EVER used a metal litter scooper. I always used plastic, and never had any reason to change materials. I come across this, and the reviews are outstanding! I got extremely curious, and purchased one. I used this scooper ONE time, and immediately threw away my plastic scoopers. It's such a different feeling compared to plastic; the metal is so sturdy, unlike plastic where you're afraid it'll snap in half and throw cat feces on you. It can pick up three times the amount of a plastic scooper; this can be washed and disinfected easily; there's nothing I hate about this product. It makes scooping litter so satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: Jaden LaBrake

customer_reviews.title: Best scoop ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best litter scoop we have ever used. It is angled just right for pickup and the openings are wide enough to quickly sift the litter. The metal scoop also seems to stay cleaner than plastic ones. Note that the scoop is wider than most other scoops we have seen. This is fine with me. But if you have a litter locker, you will find this scoop will be too wide to fit the litter locker's storage compartment. We found that if you take out the litter locker's plastic storage cup, the scoop will nest ok in the opening that remains.
customer_reviews.author: Michael N

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC buy for this new cat owner!
customer_reviews.text: I adopted a stray cat that had been visiting my yard. She is Jasmine and my first cat EVER. I spent extra on one of those sifter cat boxes, thinking it would be easier than scooping. Turns out I was wrong. This scoop is so large, and heavy duty, and can be so comfortably easy to grip...that it's actually simpler for me to just scoop out her deposits than sift. Sifting I'd only do once/twice a day, but I find I'm just doing quick scoops...more frequently...and it's working out GREAT. You can't go wrong w/this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella W.

customer_reviews.title: Saved a lot of Time and so awesome I bought a second one!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was not pleased to spend over $10 on a litter scoop, but with 4 cats (don't ask) and 5 litter boxes, the cheap plastic ones weren't hacking it. THIS SCOOPER IS AWESOME. First of all, the scoop is huge!!! So it takes a lot less time actually scooping and the slats allow pretty quick drainage of the non-clump litter so I don't have to gently shake it for a few more seconds. It feels VERY sturdy. After using it for a week, I realized my other metal scoop was sub-par vs. this and bought a second. REALLY SAVES TIME.
customer_reviews.author: Marley

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my BF and because of the reviews. It's a bit overkill for a single cat probably, but it is really nice and heavy duty. I imagine this would be one of those items that will probably never have to be replaced again unless it gets lost or something. It will probably out last our current cat and any future ones we would have, and outlast even me. If you are someone who likes pay a little more and only have to buy it once and never deal with it again, then you won't go wrong with this scoop.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: For a while now I was going back and forth to buy this scoop. I was skeptical at the beginning to spend so much money on a poop scoop, but oh wow! What a scoop! Definitely worth it! I love the round edges so much! It's much more better and bigger than my old plastic one and I scoop everything faster and easier now! Plus I bought a new litter pan here on amazon and it's a perfect duo! I'm happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Meser

customer_reviews.title: Does your cat also love to observe you poop-scooping?
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it is because I have only ever used dollar store plastic scoops for all my cat-owning days, but I feel I am wielding great power (and responsibility) when I use this thing. I can't explain it, I just feel worlds better about my cat watching me scoop her poops now. She used to, very smugly, watch me struggle to lift her massive pee clumps with a bending-til-it-snaps scoop. But alas, I have stolen at least half of her amusement by purchasing something that makes this act of subservience much less laborious. May the force be with you, fur-loving friend.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Rae

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the hype. Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I have 11(!) cats, but never dreamed I would be so enthusiastic about a litter scoop. The DuraScoop changed all that. For starters, is a thing of beauty - a solid, polished piece of aluminum with an easy-grip handle. It’s perfectly balanced, sturdy enough to scoop “concrete” clumps, and just sharp enough to easily cut afore-said concrete off the sides and bottom of the litter box. It’s large, too, which is much appreciated when cleaning our oversized, multi-cat boxes. Yeah, it’s that amazing. I can’t believe I suffered through so many years of flimsy plastic scoops. Just buy it. I promise, you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, generous size scoop
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening the box and seeing the size of the scoop I though it was too large. The construction and quality looks similar to my gardening scoop (except with holes!). I've used it for a few days now and I am very happy with the way it scoops. The large scoop size (5-1/2" wide x 5-1/2 long x 1-1/2 deep) means you take fewer sifts. There are edges so the waste does not fall off the sides. The handle is cushioned rubber and the metal scoop is described as not able to rust. Even though it costs about $13 I think it is well worth the price and should last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Zephyr

customer_reviews.title: Just Another Pooper Scooper
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would be seriously wowed considering all the rave reviews. I wasn't. Don't get me wrong, this scoop isn't terrible. It's just okay. It is huge for one. For me, it made cleaning out my cat's box awkward. It was kind of a pain to maneuver. It didn't get in the corner very well either. I had really hoped that, above all else, it would help me get the box cleaner. Those little break aways really drive me nuts. Nope! This doesn't perform any better there either. I paid about $12 for this scoop, and I was just as happy with the cheap plastic one I already had.
customer_reviews.author: R. West

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Scoop!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been frustrated with the old standard plastic litter scoops because eventually they all break, typically when you really need to use them or it is after hours and the stores are closed. This litter scoop is sturdy, easy to hold and does a great job in cleaning out our four litter boxes (we have four cats). My husband swears by them and doesn't want anything else. We started out with two and he decided we want one for each box. Once we found this product and tested it out, we have told our family and friends that have cats about it.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Great scooper
customer_reviews.text: After breaking my plastic scoop, I decided something more durable was in order. This scoop was one of the first to come up upon searching, and for good reason -- it's a good "pooper scooper." It does the job and it does it well. It took some getting used to, because it is bigger and heavier than my previous plastic one, but now it's easier than ever to clean my cats' box. I haven't had any problems with pieces falling through the slits (they're the same size as the ones on my plastic scoop). If you have a cat and have a litterbox, I recommend getting this scoop. You'll thank yourself later.
customer_reviews.author: Izen

customer_reviews.title: This almond roca scooper Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Forget those plastic scoopers! Ever had a plastic scooper break as you were trying to dig out a concrete ball out of the litter box? Well, that won't happen with this scooper. Absolutely worth more than double of what it costs. Quality is great and the handle design is nice. Made the job a lot easier. One of our cats likes to watch me scrape, struggle, sweat and curse every time I clean the litter box. Well, that wasn't the case with this scooper and I swear I'm not crazy, the cat didn't look amused. Get it! It'll change your life. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Liv

customer_reviews.title: These have spoiled me from all the other alternatives.
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw one of these, I thought it was a joke due to its size. But on first use, I was sold! With dozens of cats to care for every day, I've worn out two through the decades - but with cat centuries of use for each. When I called the scoop's makers after the first one broke (metal fatigue), they were delighted to send me two replacements for free due to their sincere appreciation of those who work with cats. Combined with a good price and excellent delivery (2 days during the COVID crisis!), who could ask for more? Many, many thanks!
customer_reviews.author: James Horn

customer_reviews.title: Good scoop, no choice of color
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality scoop, the metal goes all the way down the handle and the rubber is comfortable to hold. I just wish they'd let you pick the color you want. How hard would that be, seriously? I ordered two, and they sent me two of the same color and it was the ugliest color here. I know I shouldn't care about the color of a litter scoop, but still, I have to look at this thing multiple times per day (I have 6 cats) and it's ugly. At the very least they could have sent two different colors. There are other scoops with solid metal handles, and I'll get one of them next time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Get it! No regrets!
customer_reviews.text: I love this scoop so much! It makes my life a little easier! Since I changed from litter boxes to huge rubber made clear bins, the litter is very deep and can be tough to scoop to the bottom with a regular plastic scooper which bends and breaks if going too fast. So, this scooper is METAL all the way through and doesn’t bend at all when scooping deep! Saves energy and time! I’m so happy my old one broke and I looked for a sturdier one! The holes in it are just right for the litter I use (Tody cats)! Get it!
customer_reviews.author: Bradley n Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Best Cat Litter Scoop EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: Look no further! Seriously, this cat litter scoop is AWESOME!! (I can't believe that I am actually this excited about a cat litter scoop, but that's just how great this thing is!) It is HUGE!! Works great for those extra-large clumps that my cat likes to leave behind. It is extremely well-made and seems very sturdy. The comfort grip handle is a nice touch. It is like a mini-shovel for your cat litter! It is well worth the price because it should be the last scoop that you will ever need! I very highly recommend this scoop! You will NOT be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Amazon Mom

customer_reviews.title: The slayer of tenacious turds!
customer_reviews.text: Why oh why didn't I get one of these sooner? We have three cats and I would constantly be scraping the litter boxes with flimsy plastic litter scoops that were no match for the presents left by my 20lb big boy. This indestructible Goliath scoops up those tenacious turds and Sahara-desert=-sized urine clumps with ease; I feel like I'm wielding Excalibur when I'm fighting in the litter box trenches now! Totally worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Very large great scoop!
customer_reviews.text: Ok so this thing is huge! I find it perfect for my needs. I use the miracle line of kitty litter clumping style so it sifts out everything but poop and I mean everything! It’s very wide slats so if you don’t use clumping style or don’t want some ‘remains’ in your litter this is not for you. I personally like this but that’s because of my litter style. Scoops are totally dependent on your litter type! For me I’m so happy with this! It’s really sturdy and comfortable grip too! It’s the size of a garden shovel! Happy tails all!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Moore

customer_reviews.title: Fit for Purpose
customer_reviews.text: Prior to discovering this, and for many years, I used an old plastic backpacker's trowel to transfer cat poop from their box to the closest toilet. What's a backpacker's trowel? It's what you use to bury your poop in the wilderness. Not designed to carry cat poop gingerly with a shaky hand across carpet and hard wood floors. Quite by accident I came across the DuraScoop Jumbo Cat Litter Scoop on Amazon and ordered one. It's purrfect. Very well constructed and easy to keep clean. No more bits of cat litter (or cat poop) all over the floor. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: CessnaPilot95

customer_reviews.title: You didn’t know you needed this, but you do.
customer_reviews.text: It’s just a poop scoop, right? Why all the fuss? Well, because it’s awesome. We have two cats who (like all your cats) poop all day. And our litter clumps really well for the pee - they get heavy. The old plastic scoop we had would bend and even broke one time. I figured a metal one must exist. Sure does! This thing powers right through all of it without complaint. Easy enough to wash off if needed as well. I don’t have anything bad to say. It costs more than a crappy plastic one, but is SO much better. Just get it.
customer_reviews.author: El Duderino

customer_reviews.title: Give it a chance!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my plastic scoop that deteriorated after one year, so I searched for a metal one. My first impression of this very LARGE scoop was “no way.” But I kept using it and after several attempts I changed my thoughts on it. Because it’s so damn big, it collects everything quickly. It’s durable and seems like it will last forever. The only downside is that it doesn’t reach corners/edges well. That may not be a problem if your cat typically aims toward the center of the box (unlike mine). Other than that, a great value and find.
customer_reviews.author: MonkeyandMouse

customer_reviews.title: "One Scoop To Rule Them All!"
customer_reviews.text: Behold a litter scoop like no other! I'm dealing with six cats & grew tired of replacing the cheesy plastic or two-piece stamped steel scoops every few months. The Dura-Scoop is solid aluminum, & the polished surface helps reduce things sticking to the surface. The thick textured overmold provides an excellent grip. It is lightweight yet extremely durable. I should have bought this years ago. I'm off to challenge Adrian Paul to a litter-scooping contest. There can be only one!
customer_reviews.author: Dirty Bird

customer_reviews.title: It's basically a magic wand for cat pee.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how I even lived before this thing existed in my life. My furball is a stubborn edge pee-er, and getting those chunks that were basically cemented to the sides of the box out of there was a nightmare with a plastic scoop! Not so with this bulldozer. They come out so easily that I can't believe I've wasted so much of my life wrestling with them. Also, the large size is convenient for shortening the time it takes to treasure hunt, and the sturdiness means that I'll never have to part with it. Which is great, because it is a thing of magnificence.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: I’d give it 10 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.text: I had an old metal scoop that was welded at the connection between the scoop and handle that had broken. This guy... it’s not playing around. It’s a serious scoop. It made quick work of the litter with very little digging or wasted fresh litter. I’d give this guy 10 stars if I could. I saw some commenters saying the metal handle only goes half way up the rubberized handle cover- mine goes all the way to where the little hangy hole starts and the hangy hole/tip is stiff rubber.
customer_reviews.author: D'Anemone

customer_reviews.title: Best litter scoop!!
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY litter scoop I will ever use in my life. I bought one as a trial as I was sick of the gross plastic ones that would break. I was tired of all the kitty litter mess falling through. Not any more with this scoop! It’s SUPER durable. Easy to clean (I use corn based litter and nothing sticks to it). In total I bought three for every litter box and if anything happens to one I will purchase again in a second. Going on a year of owning the first one and it’s still like brand new!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Heaps

customer_reviews.title: BEST SCOOPER EVER!!! TOTALLY WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS SCOOPER! We own one for each litter box. We bought the first one several years ago and it's still in perfect shape. I remember being hesitant to spent so much on a scooper because we had always bought the cheap plastic ones. Then another plastic one broke on me and I was done. Once I tried this one, o regretted not getting this one sooner. It has paid for itself and then some in the plastic scoops we would have broken had we not swetched.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: If you don't want your house smelling like a cat box
customer_reviews.text: We have a cat. If you don't want your house smelling like a cat box, you have to do some regular scooping. This industrial strength, military grade, DuraScoop Litter Scoop, is a significant upgrade from the old plastic scoops. If not for it's intended use, I'd be proud to hang it up in my workshop. My wife had me order this because she's the primary cat litter scooper in the house. She volunteered for the job because we also have a large dog and I was proclaimed outdoor scooper a long time ago. My wife actually smiled when the box came from Amazon and she first saw the Durascoop. Only the best for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pez.

customer_reviews.title: Best Scooper I've Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: Last one I had literally snapped in half when scooping my cat's litter box. Not sure why they're all made of plastic, so I decided to buy this metal one, since it seems that it's going to be very durable and will hold up over time. The rubber grip is nice too, so it won't slip out of your hand. It also seems that the clumps don't stick to this as easily which is great, because it stays clean. Get rid of your old plastic scooper and buy a sturdy one like this.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Castro

customer_reviews.title: 10 Stars!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had indoor cats for decades & didn’t realize how much I disliked those plastic scoopers. You have to be somewhat careful because they bend & ultimate break due to plastic becoming brittle over time or simply break from use. I saw this one & thought I’d give it a go even though it seemed pricey relative to the plastic ones. Well .... let me tell you as a well experienced litter box cleaning warrior, these are the best ever. They are hardy, very well made & ergonomically sound. They make the job so much easier & well worth the money spent in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Justa Thought

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: My cat, Toby, is on a prescription diet that makes him urinate enough for 6 cats (at least it feels that way) and his massive spots broke the plastic scoop I had. I got the metal one and it is amazing. It breaks up spots that are too big to get at once and picks them up with no issue. It is able to scrape the junk off the bottom super easy with out chipping at it forever. It is one complete metal tool with rubber coating on the handle so it should hold up for years. Super happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Baker

customer_reviews.title: A Cat Litter Scoop And Its Handle Color
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product that likely deserves more than three stars, but imho the inability to select a specific handle color (i.e., "colors may vary") is a significant enough limitation to reduce the rating. Yes, it's "just" a cat litter scoop. And yes, I purchased it knowing I might receive a handle color I don't particularly care for. And yes, if I'm that displeased with it, I can return it to Amazon for a refund. And yes, if I'd received the blue handle color, I'd give it more stars. My primary point - and suggestion - is that customers be offered their choice of handle color. Is that really too much to ask?
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: It's a failure
customer_reviews.text: I thought this scooper would be just the ticket because it was metal and appeared to have a nice handle. But I was disappointed because the spaces between each section of metal are too far apart. The soiled litter falls through, causing me to have to rescoop several times in order to clean the litter box. Very annoying. These scoopers would be better for picking up horse poo instead of kitty cat poo. I wanted to love this product because it "looked" sturdy and solid.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Graham

customer_reviews.title: Perfect litterscoop that will last forever.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best litter scoops I have ever had. My current scoop us 11 years old. I decided to get another because we have 2 different litter rooms. They are the same great quality as years before. I can scrub them with a pumice sponge to get the icky stuff off and they're like new. The scoop Handles heavy clumps without bending or breaking. The price they have them for here was $5 less than the one I bought 11 years ago! Definitely reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Eli L.

customer_reviews.title: Scoop that poop
customer_reviews.text: The DuraScoop is a real tool for the one job you as a cat lover probably hate doing. Well I know I hate doing although this makes it a little easier this is the first cat scoop that has actually been pretty stick-resistant. I like that the pieces are sturdy and yet because of the metal type its pretty darn lightweight which is a good thing because my cats excrete boulders apparently. so far I have used this twice yes I am an annoying twice a day scooper so this will get lots of use will update in a couple of months but so far it has done wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: The Big Bertha of Cat Scoopers!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is HUGE! They're not kidding in the description! But that said, it's perfect! It is shockingly light for its size, and I like the rubberized grip. I'm replacing an old plastic scooper that I had for a long time, and where I would previously struggle to scrape the sides and bottoms of my cat's box, this just glides over the surface cleanly and smoothly. It truly was a glorious thing... well, all things considered when you realize you're scooping cat business, lol. For some, I suppose a non-jumbo size would be even better.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Hall

customer_reviews.title: If you want a salmon pink cat litter scoop, buy here
customer_reviews.text: The listing says you will get one of 3 colors, but the photos in the listing are only of the blue one, so your brain thinks you will receive a blue one. From looking at the reviews, it appears there's a strong chance you will get the "red" one. It's not red. It's a salmon pink, which, even though I'm a girl, is too girlie and obnoxious for me. And my cat, who is a female, agrees. It works well. I just have to close my eyes while using it.
customer_reviews.author: volunteer editor

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I was using a plastic cat scoop before I bought this one, and when I'd use the plastic, litter would fall from the scoop onto the floor. Not so with this scoop! It is easy to hold, and it really does the job cleaning my wonderful cat's litter box. It's so easy to scoop, and you know you're not going to be dropping anything from box to disposal. It's also very easy to clean. My terrific cat and I both agree: This is the best scoop on the market. Try it! I think you'll love it as much as we do.
customer_reviews.author: Coloratura Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Never buy another scoop!
customer_reviews.text: After going through numerous cheaper and mostly plastic scoops over the years, this all metal scoop is a shining light in the darkness of scooping litter boxes. The all-metal construction with a rubber-ish hand grip stand out from others I have used in the past, and others I looked for in need of a new scoop. The only thing that would make this scoop better is if it came with a pee-bomb radar attachment - you know the clumps of urine that inevitably get broken up by smaller or flimsier scoops and make a mess of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Levy

customer_reviews.title: STURDY!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a JOY to use. Seriously, it'll put a smile on your face. I bought a metal one from a big store that starts with "W", and while it lasted for years, the handle eventually broke. I don't see that happening with this one. Plus, the slots are larger, making it easier for the litter the pass through. Very nice. I wasn't thrilled about the color choice (mine's Teal), but we're talking about poop here, so it's not that big of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Pinetree

customer_reviews.title: Best cat litter scoop by far
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought another sturdy litter scoop that was supposed to be non-stick, but failed miserably in that category which eventually prompted the purchase of the DuraScoop. I've used it for nearly a week and while litter still sticks (much less than the other scoop) it does come off with a few solid raps on the side of the litter pail. The rubber handle sleeve twists and is on the cheap side, but not enough of an annoyance to not recommend purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: RAK

customer_reviews.title: Simply a Great Scooper. - The Best I Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using a plastic scooper for almost 40 years. When my latest plastic scooper cracked, I researched scoopers on Amazon. I never thought I’d be writing a review for a kitty litter scooper but I have to say that this scooper is great! It’s very sturdy, is ergonomically friendly and glides smoothly along the bottom of the litter box. No more digging to get into the corners with my old plastic one. The metal on this scooper is thIn but sturdy allowing me to get under what has to be scooped up. It’s unbelievable to to say but this is one of the best purchases I’ve made at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Doug N

customer_reviews.title: This could be used as a professional construction tool-holy crap !
customer_reviews.text: Yea, scoop your liter box, Dig holes in your garden. Comb the gravel in your driveway. Shovel snow and I am sure there are many more things you can use this tool for! Its huge ! Scared the heck out of my main coon when I approached the litter box for cleaning. Probably looks like a weapon of sorts to a cat???? Ok, yea it works. Boy does it work. If you have clump sticking problems, this will solve your problem. O yea, mountain climbing.....goo tool for that ! Buy one, you wont regret it ! (hahaha one is all you'll ever need)
customer_reviews.author: lance bingham

customer_reviews.title: Got the color I wanted so that is a bonus!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the turquoise color and I agree with other reviewers that you should be able to choose which color you want. So I was probably more excited than I should have been to get the color I wanted, lol. It is very large and sturdy and I think it will last pretty much forever. The only downside is that the holes are smaller than my previous one had and I can't get the litter box as clean as I would like. I definitely like the metal scoop better than a plastic one though.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa P

customer_reviews.title: This goes up to 11
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best litter scoop I have ever used. I don't know what elven magic they used to forge this with but *golf claps* bravo! There are 3 cats and 1 dog that share the 4 litterboxes (that's a lot of scooping) and they haven't stopped this thing yet! You don't have to worry about the handle breaking off mid-scoop, flinging a clump towards your wall, and you on your ass with this thing! (not like THAT happened to me or anything *shifty eyes*) For real, 100000% worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I spent this much on a litter scoop, however, if I would have purchased this first I would have saved even more money! This scoop is best used for clumping litter. If the company reads these reviews, the only design update I can think of would be to make the strainer portion on the front have thinner openings to be able to clean out the little bits that break free when cleaning the litter. I am loving this litter scoop!
customer_reviews.author: MicheleGH

customer_reviews.title: Great scooper but arrived dirty!
customer_reviews.text: This arrived dirty...but can be washed off. So I will rate it on the fact that it seems sturdy and it is a very big scooper. But I’m very disappointed I received a dirty scooper. There was stuff on the handle and the scooper part. Amazon needs to inspect the items they are sending to their customers before sending. Whatever was on the handle did not come out. Sending back would be more of a inconvenience and I think they know that.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Decent kitty litter scooper
customer_reviews.text: I have to say this is the best of several different kitty litter scoopers I have used while being a cat owner. I still have a few issues I don’t like about it, but it does get the job done. We have lots of stuff stuck on the scooper after scooping. Also-smaller particles fall through very easily. I have purchased a different non stick scooper to try so I hope that does the trick. Even with those flaws, I still love this scooper for the most part. It definitely helps make the kitty litter chore a bit easier. :)
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey T.

customer_reviews.title: Makes scooping that poop a scoop of cake
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a scoop for those poops with 9thousand horsepower designed originally for bulldozer demolition well this is it It's so sturdy one time I was done with the poops , but had the compulsion to just keep scooping so I did First through the tile , didn't stop scooped house foundation through the Earth's mantle and core once I was there we had a moment I said poop scoop nothing's impossible with you by my side and we scooped our way to china
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: The excavator for litter
customer_reviews.text: This thing is solid. No potential for broken grids. I already broke two scoopers. Maybe I have too much litter? Anyway, this is nice in the hand. I would note that it's solid on the sides so if your scooping through a large amount of litter, it may take a while to sift through. The over thing is that the scooping angle is a little too much. I would've have preferred it less angled. Overall, I wanted a solid scooper and that's what I got.
customer_reviews.author: joschmo

customer_reviews.title: For Cat Lovers
customer_reviews.text: I did not know what I was missing before I bought this solid metal litter scooper. The plastic one I have used for years bothered me with how little control it offered when scraping out clumped litter stuck on the sides and bottom of the tray. This litters scoop feels like a tool.......the plastic ones now I know are like toys. Do yourself a big favor and upgrade. Anything to make the chore of a dirty job a little more pleasant is well worth it. Sometimes you don't know the things that will make a difference in your life. Seems silly, but this is one of those items.
customer_reviews.author: Starlifter777

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, durable scoop
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent cat litter scoop. It is a single piece of metal, but the handle is wrapped in rubber for comfort. The beveled edge does an excellent job of loosening litter stuck to the bottom of the pan. The vents are larger than with most scoops, and lets the loose littler drain out quickly. The only negative is that the larger vents allow small clumps to pass through. However, this is a very minor issue. Overall this scoop does a great job of cleaning the litter box.
customer_reviews.author: avidreader

customer_reviews.title: I use it for quails, not cats... really
customer_reviews.text: I do not use this for its intended purpose, but if I had a cat and had to manually scoop, I could use this for sure as the scoop is very sturdy. I use it to scoop the litter out of "poop-trays" under some quails cages/hutch. This works well for that. I gave it 5 stars as I can leave it outside, and not worry about it rusting or anything like that. This is also quite large, so a lot can be scooped at once.
customer_reviews.author: T.Perraut

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this scoop due to the promise of sturdiness and it certainly delivers on that front. I am not awarding 5 stars because the front edge it too thick to easily scrape the bottom of the pan and the slots are too wide to catch smaller clumps. The inexpensive Walmart meatal scoop was excellent at scraping the pan and catching small clumps but was too easily bendable. I am searching for a model that meets all three criteria - durability, scrapability, and ability to catch the smallest of clumps.
customer_reviews.author: JulzGaye

customer_reviews.title: This is the John Deere of litter scoops!
customer_reviews.text: This scoop is legit and worth your money. This is not a wimpy scoop, it looks like a small slotted snow shovel. The shovel is wide enough to get several large clumps at one time; for me, it makes cleaning my litter box faster and easier. This is not flimsy at all and it’s got an ergonomic rubberized/texturized grip so you will not drop this sucker and it’s long enough that you won’t be up to your elbows in your litter box.
customer_reviews.author: ARIA WATSON

customer_reviews.title: Good poop scoop
customer_reviews.text: Best poop scoop I've ever owned! You can get right to the very bottom on the box without worrying you're gonna break the scoop. The scoop is ginormous and seriously makes the gross poop job faster and easier. I've had the scoop for a few months and have not had one problem with it. I scoop poo every day because we are a 2 cat family....buy it, you'll love it. I'm not gonna be dumb and say it's a life changer cuz, let's face it...it's a cat poo scooper ... But it's pretty great for what it's made for.
customer_reviews.author: tarie

customer_reviews.title: The best litter scoop by far
customer_reviews.text: Certainly better than a plastic scoop but also the best metal scoop I have used. It is large without any sharp edges, strong and the litter does not stick to it. I tried another scoop, the IPRIMO scoop which is coated with a non-stick coating but the Dura Scoop is much better and the litter sticks to it less than to the one with the non-stick coating. It is also larger and scoops better. Cleaning the litter is never a job I love but this scoop makes it easier and quicker than any other I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: A Reader NYC

customer_reviews.title: Big, nice, works
customer_reviews.text: What a great change it was, after many years of using cat scoopers-- to switch from small, flimsy, plastic scoopers, to this very big, solid metal scooper. I use the recycled paper litter, and this scooper makes the process of cleaning large litter boxes very easy, due to the large size of the scooper. Nice scooping angle, solid design that will never break. There are likely other scoopers that are just as good, since it's a pretty basic concept, but all in all, recommending this scooper is a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scoop since my plastic litter scoops were struggling to scrape the stuck litter from the bottom of the tray. This is a quality product, single cast unit so the handle will not break off as some do. The price is fantastic. My only hesitation in giving the product 5 stars is the size - it is just a little too big to easily navigate in a standard size litter box. If it were about 7/8s the size it would be perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff in Catskills

customer_reviews.title: Best scoop ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cat litter scoop. It is the best I have ever seen or used. We had some other metal ones that were great but they bent easy, which then makes them hard to use. I have ordered two of these and am ordering another one. We have four cats in our house and I would like to have one for each litter box area. My brother bent the other metal one because he doesn't know his own strength at times but has never bent this one. It is great.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Dupuis

customer_reviews.title: The Last Scoop You'll Need to Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect scoop to use with clumping cat litter. It is STRONG! I no longer need to sift through the litter an inch at a time to make sure I don't break the scoop. I spend half the time I used to cleaning the litter box. There is enough of a lip so you can use it to pick up the little crumbs that inevitably form when large clumps fall off the side of the litter box. The slots are large enough that the reusable litter sifts through easily, but small enough that no waste escapes. Go ahead and splurge, you'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: mugwump55

customer_reviews.title: Best scoop out there.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second scoop. Bought first one at petsmart years ago. After cheap plastic ones snapped in half cleaning litter box. Which super annoying. Since then have Accumulated more cats and litter boxes. Nice wide scoop, extremely sturdy. Easy to clean. And the first one is at least 10 years or older. So really these last forever. Unless your doing something weird. I’ve read some bad reviews. Think it’s the crappy competition. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Michele Coletti

customer_reviews.title: Best Scoop On the Market
customer_reviews.text: Why do I need a cat scoop, you ask? “Why, you have nary a kitten!” It’s true: I don’t have a cat. However (and alas), my NEIGHBOR has cats—and feeds the strays to boot—so my yards have become, essentially, huge, stinky litter boxes. You gotta have the right tool for the job. Ideally, I’d use a .12 gauge, but since CA has strict laws about such things, I got this scoop instead. It is tough as nails, and its flinging capacity is second to none. (Oh, yes, I fling. Sorry, neighbor: your cats, your poop. YOU clean it up.)
customer_reviews.author: ReCynd

customer_reviews.title: Poop Ninja
customer_reviews.text: This pooper scoopers is by far the best ive ever used. When i goto the litter box and the cats didnt go last night. I am actually upset that i cant use it. I am thinking about having my wife poop in a box for me. Just so i can use it more often. Its a good one. It has a Sharp metal edge which allows me to get under them damned peeball on the bottom of the box. It also makes a cool metal shwing noise when i twirl it around. I feel like the poop ninja. Just buy it. Youll love it.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: The Rolls Royce of litter scoops
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is a big litter scoop. You need this if you have big cat business to attend to, otherwise it might be too much scoop. I have a couple of big boys Blue and Hootie. They do the biggest pees. Being able to get their enormous pee clumps out in one piece is so much easier with this scoop. There is no way that a mere plastic scoop could do the job. I am very happy with this scoop. It is very well made and sturdy. I have no problem sifting out unused cat litter.
customer_reviews.author: Atomic Nightlight

customer_reviews.title: Best cat litter scoop I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: Best cat litter scoop I ever bought. All these years trying to remove the clumps stuck to the side and swearing doing it and all I had to do was buy this. It picks up the waste easily. It makes the job...I wouldn't go as far as saying fun but I am not reluctant to do it anymore. The scoop is sturdy (I'd even go as far as to say that it is more sturdy than some gardening small shovels). It's easy to keep clean. Nothing really sticks to it and if it does, I just knock it on the side and it goes away. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Miri

product_meta.title: DuraScoop Jumbo Cat Litter Scoop, All Metal End-to-End with Solid Core, Sifter with Deep Shovel, Multi-Cat Tested Accept No Substitute for the Original (colors may vary)
product_meta.description: The DuraScoop is a real tool for the one job you as a cat lover probably hate doing. It's cast, end-to-end in one piece, from high-grade rust-resistant ADC-12 aluminum. Then it's hand polished and the ergonomic handle is fitted with a soft non-slip, phthalate-free plastic coating. It's big but lightweight and incredibly durable. It lets you dig out the big clumps, scrape the bottoms and sides of the pan while reducing time, effort and strain on your wrist. The solid enclosed sides are designed to minimize scatter of soiled litter during sifting. And it won't bend or break or flick icky cat doo out of the box or in your face. Assorted colors are mint green, watermelon pink and sky blue.
feature_bullets: The ONLY end-to-end all-aluminum litter scoop on Amazon, patented design.
Solid metal handle with comfortable molded rubber coating. Don’t accept inferior partially-plastic substitutes.
Jumbo size yet amazingly light in the hand.
Ergonomically balanced with center of gravity toward user’s wrist.
Mirror finish, not plated, coated or painted – will not rub off! Corrosion resistant – will not rust.
Multi-cat tested for over 15 years and counting. Designed and sold in the USA.
